channel.title: Notch's SkinTest w/ frame + bugfix
channel.description:
I am sure some of you know that Notch had a skin preview applet on minecraft.net a while back, in the Alpha days. I found a copy I had on an old external and decided I would fix it, as well as add a JFrame. All classes within this JAR are original, except for ModelPreviewFrame. After I get my internet back and am not using my phones mobile hotspot capabilities I will post a pastebin of that class.
Picture (JFrame): [img]http://soharuda.webuda.com//images/1312791304.png[/img]
DL: http://up.ht/nJUvnH

item.title: Notch's SkinTest w/ frame + bugfix
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

noobs are ftw:

sweet i missed this y did he remove it?

I believe it actually checked the link before sending page data, and if a 404 was returned, then it shows what he has now. I think he just needs to update the link.

Read full topic

item.title: Notch's SkinTest w/ frame + bugfix
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

mironic:

coon give this to notch so we can has a skin viewer againz

That is a bug within Notch’s jsp pages I believe. The entire skin is being loaded via a URL. The bug I encountered was the skintest2.jar wanting to limit itself to minecraft.net/skin as a host. I will talk to Notch though here soon if he doesn’t get it fixed, because its sad when I can type this up on TeamViewer on my phone (yes, my phone is like my computer right now -.-) and such. When its taking Notch months to even shed a glimpse.

Read full topic
